byline.contributor: Hawes Spencer reported from Charlottesville, Va., and Ben Sisario from New York.
byline.original: By HAWES SPENCER and BEN SISARIO

abstract: Federal jury in Charlottesville, Va, awards University of Virginia administrator Nicole P Eramo $3 million in damages, deciding writer Sabrina Rubin Erdely is liable for $2 million of total and Rolling Stone magazine and its parent company Wenner Media for rest; several days prior, Eramo won her defamation lawsuit against Rolling Stone for making her look like chief villain in article about alleged gang rape on college campus.

headline.print_headline: $3 Million Award in Rolling Stone Case
headline.main: In Rolling Stone Defamation Case, Magazine and Reporter Ordered to Pay $3 Million

snippet: Jurors found a reporter, Sabrina Rubin Erdely, liable for $2 million and said Rolling Stone and its parent owed $1 million in a defamation case....
